translation: Dajiyi shenzhou jing, vol. 1

source_sentence: 元魏昭玄統沙門釋曇曜譯
translation: Translated by Shi Tangyao, an ascetic of Zhao Xuantong in the Yuan Dynasty

source_sentence: 南無諸佛眾生真濟於一切法得自在者。
translation: "Namo, all buddhas and sentient beings truly aid those who attain mastery over all dharmas.
The seven buddhas truly aid Vipaśyin.
Śikhin.
Bṛhatphala [Śākyamuni + Rice] Vātsīputra.
Krakucchanda!
Kanakamuni ...
Kāśyapa.

source_sentence: 釋師子兩足之尊有大名稱。
translation: The two-legged lion of the Śākyas has a great reputation.

source_sentence: 彌勒在兜率天上與大眾圍繞。
translation: Maitreya was up in Tuṣita Heaven surrounded by the great crowd.

source_sentence: 我至心念過去一切諸佛。
translation: "I was deeply mindful of all the buddhas of the past.
'All the buddhas of the future!'

source_sentence: 現在一切諸佛無上法王。
translation: 'All the buddhas of the present are unsurpassed Dharma kings.'
Thus are all the buddhas of the three times.
I give my life to them all, and I take them all as refuge.

source_sentence: 歸依於法而此法者一切所敬。
translation: I take refuge in the Dharma, and this Dharma is honored by all of them.
I take refuge in the saṃgha.
This congregation of monks is called a superior field of merit.
If they make a small donation, it will have great rewards.

source_sentence: 是諸如來及諸聲聞今皆歸依。
translation: These tathāgatas and śrāvakas now all take refuge in him.

source_sentence: 又復歸命住色究竟摩醯首羅。
translation: They also give their lives to Mahêśvara, who abides at the end of his days in form.

source_sentence: 歸命首陀會天諸阿那含天。
translation: They also give their lives to the Śuddhâvāsa gods and the non-returning gods.
I give my vows to the Brahma Heavenly Kings, the world's patriarchs.
I give my vows to the king of the heaven of paranirmita-vaśavartin.
Homage to the god king of transformation and bliss.
to the king of Tuṣita Heaven.
"To the god Śuyāmaṇeras, I give my vows.
Venerate Indra as king of the gods.
"I give my vows to the four great guardian kings of the world.

source_sentence: 歸命諸依地者一切鬼神。
translation: I give my vows to all the ghosts and spirits of the bhūmis.
I give my vows to all the dragons and gandharvas.
To Indra, the king of the desire realm.

source_sentence: 炎羅婆樓[少/兔]那素摩波羅墮闍仙波闍波提。
translation: Indravāḍu [less/rabbit], Sumeru, Polapāla, and Sāṅgāra, Bojapati, and Bhadrapati.
All of these now take refuge in the order of their lives.
The two sages, Nārada-prabhāsa and Nandana-prabhāsa, are powerful.
Now, he teaches a spell that makes all things meaningful and auspicious.
It's a combination of the nectar of immortality and the domain of death.
It's capable of performing 500 deeds.
It can make all actions auspicious.
It's a spell that stops all the bad spells of the tricky path.
It protects all worlds.

source_sentence: 能令一切諸惡鬼神皆令退散。
translation: It can cause all bad spirits to retreat.

source_sentence: 一切侵害人者盡能除滅。
translation: It can remove all those who harm people.

source_sentence: 能令一切所作悉皆吉善。
translation: It causes everything that's done to be good.
It can cause evil people to become frightened.
Those who want to recite the dhāraṇī should do so with a sincere heart.

source_sentence: 以妙香華鬘塗香末香寶蓋幢幡。
translation: Use fine incense, flower garlands, coated incense, powdered incense, jewels, shrouds, banners, and flags.
Produce music, musicians, and subtle sounds.

source_sentence: 供養於彼滅結世尊如來。
translation: Make offerings to that Tathāgata, the World Honored One who has extinguished the bonds of affliction.
He purifies and ends the afflictions.
He collects his mind in concentration and doesn't scatter it.
He practices the four great vows to protect all [sentient beings].
He produces the wonderful voice of Brahmā, and his thunderous voice vibrates far and wide.
It's like something people at Kaliṅga would love to hear.
Please accept my highest offerings!

source_sentence: 南無過去未來現在一切諸佛。
translation: Namu, all the buddhas of the past, future, and present.
Namo Vipaśyin Buddha.
Śikhin Buddha!
Vaiśravaṇa Buddha!
Kālānakasandha Buddha!
Kanakamuni Buddha ...
Kāśyapa Buddha ... Śākyamuni Buddha ...

source_sentence: 彌勒上首十方世界如恒沙數。
translation: Maitreya is the head of a world in ten directions as numerous as the sands of the Ganges.

source_sentence: 多陀阿伽度阿羅呵三藐三佛陀。
translation: Tathāgata, Agastya, Arhat, and Samantabhadra Buddhas.
He provides great relief for sentient beings.
If there's trouble or calamity, he can make it good and fortunate.

source_sentence: 審如是者我今至誠運香供養。
translation: Considering this, I now wholeheartedly carry incense to make offerings.
May the fragrance of this incense reach the buddhas.
He then spoke the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 達遲　陀遲　阿遲　阿遲　寐遲　阿遲　那遲　彌遲說是呪已燒諸名香蘇合香等。
translation: "Daji, daji, jiji, jiji, jiji, naji, and miji, after saying this dhāraṇī, burned various famous incense sticks and so forth.

source_sentence: 供養三世一切諸佛人中師子。
translation: He offered offerings to all the buddhas of the three times, as well as to lions among men.
Always remember the blessings that have been bestowed on me.

source_sentence: 復次至心燒眾名香薩闍賴闍香等。
translation: "Furthermore, he burns with utmost care the incense of the many well-known buddhas, such as the incense of sarvajña-rajña.

source_sentence: 運心供養摩醯首羅天王。
translation: With all my heart, I'll make offerings to Mahêśvara, the king of the gods.
May this fragrance reach his celestial palace.
He then said this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 那那　那那　那那　囉囉　囉囉　囉囉　呵梨　阿梨　帝[口*梨]　俟羅帝　[口*梨]帝　斯帝復次誠心燒眾名香逼佉香等。
translation: 那那　那那　那那　囉囉　囉囉　囉囉　呵梨　阿梨　帝[口*梨]　俟羅帝　[口*梨]帝　斯帝復次誠心燒眾名香逼佉香等。

source_sentence: 運心供養欲界魔王有大勢力欲界之主。
translation: He makes offerings with his mind to the demon king of the desire realm, the lord of the desire realm who has great power.
May this fragrance reach the king's abode.
He then spoke the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 豆豆　豆豆　豆豆　豆尼　豆尼　豆尼　披那　訶[口*兮]　呵尼　陀遲　摩尼　[口*梨]帝復次誠心燒眾名香弗迦香等運心供養化樂天王并化樂諸天。
translation: 豆豆　豆豆　豆豆　豆尼　豆尼　豆尼　披那　訶[口*兮]　呵尼　陀遲　摩尼　[口*梨]帝復次誠心燒眾名香弗迦香等運心供養化樂天王并化樂諸天。
May this fragrance reach the king's abode.

source_sentence: 若不憶念我當頭破作七分。
translation: If he doesn't remember me, his head will be broken into seven parts.
He then says this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 尼梨　尼黎　尼黎　寐黎　寐黎　寐黎　脂隷　脂隷　彌脂隷　彌脂隷復次誠心燒眾名香。
translation: 尼梨　尼黎　尼黎　寐黎　寐黎　寐黎　脂隷　脂隷　彌脂隷　彌脂隷復次誠心燒眾名香。
He makes offerings with his mind to the gods of the other kings.
May the fragrance of this incense reach that king's place.
Remembering me, he then said this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 迦隷　婆隷　那隷　呵隷　毘那隷　毘舍隷　訶羅彌帝莎呵復次我今誠心燒眾名香。
translation: "Kāśyapa, Nāgasena, Nāgasena, Hāritī, Vaiśālī, Hārāmaṇerī, and Sahahā. Now, I'll wholeheartedly burn many name-branded incense sticks.
I'll wholeheartedly offer them to King Tuṣita.
May the fragrance of this incense reach the king's place.
I will then accept his offerings.
He then spoke the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 摩私　摩私　摩私　摩摩私　娑羅摩私　摩那私　呵羅尼　呵富呵　波羅尼　賀梨　寐帝　乾途　婆賀羅　莎呵復次我今燒眾名香。
translation: "Mahêśvara, Mahêśvara, Mahêśvara, Sālamâśvara, Mahêśvara, Hārāya, Maitreya, Gantu, Bāhāra, and Sahêśvara. Furthermore, I now burn many well-known incense sticks.

source_sentence: 運心供養須耶門天王輔相將從。
translation: I'm going to make offerings to King Śuyāmaṇi, assistants to the gods, and followers.
May this fragrance reach the king's quarters.
He then said this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 佉咃　佉尼咃　佉稚毘尼　薩旨遲
translation: "Khatti, Khatnitti, Khatsibini, and Sarvâstivāda.

source_sentence: 薩持遲地茶　婆婆利　乾頭　婆賀羅　莎呵復次燒眾名香。
translation: Sāgaradhvaja, Bhalli, Gandhāra, and Sahassākkha then burned the many famous incense sticks.

source_sentence: 運心供養帝釋三十三天王。
translation: He makes a mental offering to Trāyastriṃśa, the king of the Indra Heaven.
May the fragrance of this incense reach that king's abode.
He then said this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 賀羅　賀羅　摩黎尼　遮羅私利　毘羅私利復次燒眾名香。
translation: "Hora, Hora, Mālīnī, Cālīśālī, and Vīrabhīśālī then burn the many name-dedicated incense sticks.

source_sentence: 運心供養東方提頭賴吒天王輔相眷屬。
translation: He then made a mental offering to the assistants and followers of King Titurāṭa of the east.
May the fragrance of this incense reach the king's retinue.

source_sentence: 運心供養南方毘留勒叉天王輔相眷屬。
translation: He then burned a multitude of name-branded incense and made offerings with his mind to the auxiliary members of the southern Virūḍhaka gods.
May the fragrance of this incense reach the king's retinue.

source_sentence: 毘利私　毘利私　旨利私　寐利私　寐尼利私復次燒眾名香。

source_sentence: 運心供養西方毘留博又天王輔相眷屬。

May the fragrance of this incense reach the king's quarters.

source_sentence: 豆嚁　鼻豆嚁　鼻[口*兮]　[口*兮]寐　呵[口*兮]寐寐　寐利　至寐利　至寐利帝　呵羅帝　莎呵復次燒眾名香。

source_sentence: 運心供養北方毘沙門天王輔相眷屬。

source_sentence: 佉稚　佉稚　佉佉稚　佉佉稚　摩稚　摩稚私　摩茶　呵梨膩復次燒眾名香。
translation: 佉稚　佉稚　佉佉稚　佉佉稚　摩稚　摩稚私　摩茶　呵梨膩復次燒眾名香。

source_sentence: 運心供養大海渚中楞伽城內羅剎之主毘沙拏。
translation: He offered them with his mind to Vaiśravaṇa, the lord of the Rājasas in the great island city of Laṅkā.
May the fragrance of this incense reach that place.
He then said this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 遮利　遮利　周利　周利　帝利　帝利　婆羅尼利　婆羅呵帝尼　呵羅蜜帝　莎呵復次燒眾名香。

source_sentence: 運心供養毘摩質多羅阿修羅王居在海邊。
translation: He makes offerings with his mind to King Vimalacitra, the asura king who lives at the edge of the ocean.
May the fragrance of this incense reach the king's abode.
He then said this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 伊支　毘支　毘遮支　遮吒隷　摩吒隷摩摩吒　阿羅蜜帝　莎呵復次燒眾名香。
translation: "Ichi, Vichi, Vaijacchi, Cāṭacana, Māṭacana, Māṭacana, and Aramiti, Sahā burned numerous name-branded incense sticks in sequence.

source_sentence: 運心供養伽羅龍王居在海中。
translation: He offered them to the dragon king Kālā in the ocean with his mind.
May the fragrance of this incense reach the dragon king.
He then said this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 迦　迦　迦利　迦羅尼利　迦羅婆梨尼　毘黎私利　呵羅蜜帝　莎婆呵復次燒眾名香。
translation: "Kā-kā-ri, Kālānī-ri, Kālāpālinī, Vṛji-ri, Ārāmitī, and Sahassākkha burn numerous name-dedicated incense sticks.
He makes offerings to the earth spirit with his mind.
May the fragrance of this odor reach that place.
He then spoke the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 毘陳地[口*梨]　毘婆陳提[口*梨]　遮隣提梨　舍囉摩[口*梨]遲　摩摩囉囉遲　阿羅彌帝　莎呵若不信我呪。
translation: "Vairocana [muzzle*ri], Vipaacanti [muzzle*ri], Cāṇḍindi [muzzle*ri], śrama [muzzle*ri], and Māmara [muzzle*ri], if you don't believe my dhāraṇī, your heart will split into seven parts of blood and flow from your face to yours.

source_sentence: 心裂作七分血從面門出。
translation: His heart will split into seven parts and his blood will come out through his face.
If someone doesn't listen to the good teaching of the Buddha, they'll never receive good fortune and be killed by illness.
I'll never get any luck, and I'll be killed by illness.

source_sentence: 身壞命終當墮地獄天阿修羅共相鬪戰。
translation: When his body breaks up and his life ends, he'll fall into hell, and gods and asuras will fight with each other.
At the time, Indra's army was defeated and retreated.
After he entered the city, he thought.

source_sentence: 我今當詣婆伽婆所求索擁護。
translation: 'Now, I will go to Bhagavān and ask for protection.
Among gods and humans, the Buddha is the most distinguished.
He's compassionate and saves all sentient beings.
He doesn't harm them all and always protects them.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊在憂波難陀山常所樂處。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān was staying at his usual place of comfort on Mount Upananda.
He was accompanied by a large assembly of 500 monks.
There were a thousand nayutas of bodhisattvas.
It was the fifteenth day of the moon when he was preaching.
The two-legged honored one was among the highest of humans and gods.
He was surrounded by four crowds like a bright lamp of the world.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因與其將從百千那由他三十三天。
translation: Śakrodevānām and his generals came from the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven with a hundred thousand nayutas.

source_sentence: 來詣佛所頂禮佛足却坐一面一心合掌。
translation: They came to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and joined their palms with one heart.
He spoke a verse, saying.

source_sentence: 大聖世雄天人尊　　常以慈心愍一切　善哉一切智導師　　世間黑闇作照明　一切諸天所不達　　唯有瞿曇獨知之　今我歸命大慈悲　　唯願為我作擁護爾時世尊聞此偈已告帝釋言。
translation: "Most noble of the gods and humans, the constant compassionate mind that looks after all is excellent, the guide of omniscience, the darkness of the world that's illuminated by darkness, which is not reached by all the gods, but is known only by the Gautama. I take refuge in the great compassion and wish to be my protector." After hearing this verse, the Bhagavān addressed Śuddhodana, saying.

source_sentence: 天帝我佛法中有結呪界法。
translation: "Deva, there's a Dharma spell in my Buddhist teachings that binds the Dharma realm.
It can be a great shield for humans and gods.
If anyone hears this dhāraṇī, then they'll maintain it or teach others to maintain it.
Whether you uphold it yourself or teach others to uphold it, recite it wholeheartedly and cultivate it as described.
He recites it wholeheartedly and cultivates it as he says.
Because of the power of the dhāraṇī, a sword can't be wounded.

source_sentence: 毒火不害能却怨敵百由旬內無諸災患。
translation: It's harmless to poisonous fires and can defeat enemies for a hundred leagues without causing misfortune.
The gods, asuras, and all spirits will not be able to surpass this spell's boundary and cause harm.

source_sentence: 無能越此呪界而作衰害。
translation: They can't surpass the boundaries of this spell and cause harm.

source_sentence: 是故天帝應當受持是結呪法。
translation: Therefore, the gods should accept and uphold this dhāraṇī.
He should recite it with utmost care and not forget it.
He then spoke the spell, saying.

source_sentence: 闍隷　闍梨尼　摩闍隷　摩呵闍隷　摩何闍羅婆帝　阿闍利　阿者利　闍羅者利　闍[口*兮]隷　摩隷　[口*兮]摩摩隷　闍囉帝　遮囉婆囉帝　者羅帝　者囉闍囉帝　那囉帝　婆羅闍隷　伊[口*梨]伊囉婆帝　寐[口*梨]　寐羅婆帝　合鞞唎合鞞[口*梨]　毘唎　合子　翅由唎　摩呵翅由囉　婆帝　摩佉唎　摩呵　摩佉唎　呵羅私唎　婆闍梨　婆伽踰唎　鍮囉婆利　婆囉婆私唎　毘私唎　私利　私唎　私唎膩以此實呪擁護帝主眾患都除。

source_sentence: 我今慈彼提頭賴吒龍王。
translation: Now, I'll have compassion on that Dhṛtarāṣṭra.
King Tidhurāṣṭrapāṇi.
Vīrabhāṣṭha-rāja, the Black Gautama-nāga-rāja.

translation: Vasubandhu, the Dragon King of Dantaliputra.
Pūrṇabhadra-nāga-rāja.
Nandanavana-nāga-rājā.

source_sentence: 名色威力身體俱大住須彌山。
translation: His name, form, authority, and body are both great, and he lives on Mount Sumeru.
When gods and asuras fight, they're always assisted by Tiljita and supported by him.
He's always supporting Tissa and acting as his protector.
